articleContent.title: Chord: Minor 6th in E (Shape: E)
articleContent.content:
# Minor 6th Chord in E

The Minor 6th chord in the key of E is a beautiful and haunting chord with a touch of melancholy. It consists of the notes E, G, B, and C#.

## Notes and Intervals
- E (Root)
- G (Minor 3rd)
- B (5th)
- C# (6th)

## Musical Flavor
The Minor 6th chord in E is commonly used in jazz, blues, and other genres to evoke a sense of longing or contemplation. It has a bittersweet quality that adds emotional depth to music.

## Songs
1. "Autumn Leaves" - The Minor 6th chord in E can be heard in this jazz standard, adding a touch of sophistication to the chord progressions.
  
2. "Purple Haze" by Jimi Hendrix - This iconic rock song features the Minor 6th chord in E, giving it a mysterious and psychedelic vibe.

3. "Ain't No Sunshine" by Bill Withers - The Minor 6th chord in E is used in this soul classic to convey the sense of loss and heartache in the lyrics.
